text:
Video of the day: iPhone 11 Pro Max vs Pixel 4 XL in speed test
05 Nov 2019, 10:15 by Daria Gromova
Guess who won?
Yutuber PhoneBuff compared the speed of top-end smartphones from Apple and Google. What will prevail: the top-end Apple A13 Bionic processor in the iPhone 11 Pro Max or two "extra" GB of RAM in the Pixel 4 XL?



In fact, the result became apparent at the first stage of the test. iPhone loaded a 500-page document with bewitching ease. The superiority of the smartphone was only confirmed in Snapseed and Premiere Rush, where the ‚Äúpixel‚Äù took a couple of seconds more to add filters and render the video. Game load times were about the same, but the Pixel was left behind due to previous tests.
For the test, 16 applications were used - and the iPhone had 4 GB of RAM to keep 11 of them open. Pixel with its 6 GB, on the other hand, was only enough for 9 programs: Premiere Rush and Snapseed still went to reboot when they restarted. In fairness, it is worth noting that, compared to the Pixel 3 XL, the new model has significantly improved its performance - even if this was not enough to defeat the iPhone.
